solution_line_template: On Mondays, he walks {distance_per_day} miles at {speed_monday} miles per hour, for a length of {distance_per_day}/{speed_monday}=<<{distance_per_day}/{speed_monday}={time_monday}>>{time_monday} hours.

On Wednesdays, he walks {distance_per_day} miles at {speed_wednesday} miles per hour, for a length of {distance_per_day}/{speed_wednesday}=<<{distance_per_day}/{speed_wednesday}={time_wednesday}>>{time_wednesday} hours.

And on Fridays, he runs {distance_per_day} miles at {speed_friday} miles per hour, for a length of {distance_per_day}/{speed_friday}=<<{distance_per_day}/{speed_friday}={time_friday}>>{time_friday} hour.
The combined total time he spends exercising in a week is {time_monday}+{time_wednesday}+{time_friday}=<<{time_monday}+{time_wednesday}+{time_friday}={total_time}>>{total_time} hours.
